Overview: This is a graduate Machine Learning Series, initially created by Charles Isbell (University of Wisconsin-Madison) and Michael Littman (Brown University) where the lectures are Socratic discussions on the material. The course is lead by TJ LaGrow (Georgia Tech) with significant refactoring and refurbishment.
Course Content: To access the public version of this course's content, clickhere, then log into your Ed Lessons account. If you have not already created an Ed Lessons account, enter your name and email address, then click the activation link sent to your email, then revisit that link.
An introductory course in artificial intelligence is recommended but not required. To discover whether you are ready to take CS 7641: Machine Learning, please review ourCourse Preparedness Questions, to determine whether another introductory course may be necessary prior to registration.
